revised_title: The Influence of Environmental Conditions on the Virulence of the Tuberculosis Bacillus
tldr: The author investigates the impact of environmental factors, such as light, air, and soil, on the virulence of the tuberculosis bacillus. The study finds that exposure to sunlight and fresh air can reduce the virulence of the bacillus, while exposure to darkness and poor ventilation can increase its virulence.
